title: How to Tighten Your Wheels and Trucks on a Tech Deck

steps.headline: Take out the little, yellow tool that came with the Tech-Deck.
steps.description: If you don't have one of these, you can ask to borrow one from a friend or buy one for a dollar.

steps.headline: Tighten the loose trucks first.
steps.description: The trucks are loose if you can wobble them easily.

steps.headline: Insert the screwdriver end of the tool into the bolt of the truck you're tightening first.
Keep twisting the tool this direction until the truck is nice and stiff.
Tighten any loose wheels only after the trucks are tight.
steps.description: Wheels are loose if they move on their axles, along the lines where they are attached.

steps.headline: Insert the screwdriver end of the tool into one of the wheels, right into the middle.
Twist clockwise until twisting the wheel furthermore is firm.
Repeat with all of the wheels.

text: Take out the little, yellow tool that came with the Tech-Deck. If you don't have one of these, you can ask to borrow one from a friend or buy one for a dollar. Also take out the tech-deck.  Tighten the loose trucks first. The trucks are loose if you can wobble them easily. Insert the screwdriver end of the tool into the bolt of the truck you're tightening first.  Twist the tool clockwise direction.  Keep twisting the tool this direction until the truck is nice and stiff.  Repeat with the second truck.  Tighten any loose wheels only after the trucks are tight. Wheels are loose if they move on their axles, along the lines where they are attached. Insert the screwdriver end of the tool into one of the wheels, right into the middle.  Twist clockwise until twisting the wheel furthermore is firm.  Repeat with all of the wheels.
sentences: Take out the little, yellow tool that came with the Tech-Deck.
If you don't have one of these, you can ask to borrow one from a friend or buy one for a dollar.
The trucks are loose if you can wobble them easily.
Insert the screwdriver end of the tool into the bolt of the truck you're tightening first.
Keep twisting the tool this direction until the truck is nice and stiff.
Tighten any loose wheels only after the trucks are tight.
Wheels are loose if they move on their axles, along the lines where they are attached.
Insert the screwdriver end of the tool into one of the wheels, right into the middle.
Twist clockwise until twisting the wheel furthermore is firm.
Repeat with all of the wheels.
